worms.model

Class Worm

  • java.lang.Object
    • worms.model.Worm

  • public class Worm
extends java.lang.Object
    WORMS!! The class Worm contains all information and methods related to the actual worms and their movements.
    Author:
    Milan Sanders, Joren Vaes

        public void setRadius(double radius)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        radius - The new radius for the worm
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the given radius is not a legal radius. | ! isValidRadius(radius)

      • getMass

        public double getMass()
        Returns:
        the mass calculated from radius | result == 1062 * ((4.0 / 3.0) * Math.PI * Math.pow(getRadius() , 3)

      • getMaxActionPoints

        public int getMaxActionPoints()
        Returns:
        the maximum amount of actionpoints this worm can have | result == (int)Math.round(getMass())

      • getActionPoints

        @Basic
public int getActionPoints()
        Returns:
        the current amount of actionpoints of the worm. | result == this.ActionPoints

        public double getJumpTime()

        the jumpTime

      • isValidPoints

        public boolean isValidPoints(int points)
        Parameters:
        points - the amount of points of which you want to know if it is a valid amount
        Returns:
        true if the given value is greater or equal to zero and less than or equal to the max value of AP for this worm | result == ((points >= 0) && (points <= getMaxActionPoints())

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(int steps)
        Parameters:
        steps - The amount of steps the worm should move
        Returns:
        True if the worm can move that much steps. This means that the worm has enough actionpoints, every step takes (cos(getOrientation())) + 4*sin(getOrientation()). | result == (Math.abs(Math.cos(getOrientation())) + Math.abs(Math.sin(getOrientation())) * 4 * steps)

      • step

        public void step(int steps)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 worms.ExhaustionException
        Parameters:
        steps - The amount of steps to be moved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the amount of steps is smaller than 0. | (steps <= 0)
        worms.ExhaustionException - If the worm does not have enought actionpoints. | (!canMove(steps))

      • turn

        public void turn(double amount,
        boolean active)
        Adds a given angle to the current orientation of the worm. Nominally, because part of orientation
        Parameters:
        amount -
        active - Is true if turning was active and thus subtracts action points.

      • canJump

        public boolean canJump()
        Returns:
        true when the orientation of the worm is valid (between 0 and pi) and the worm has action points remaining | result == (isValidOrientation() && getActionPoints() > 0)

      • jump

        public void jump()
          throws worms.ExhaustionException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Throws:
        worms.ExhaustionException - if the worm no longer has any actionpoitns.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • jumpTime

        public double jumpTime()
        Mandatory 'jumpTime' function as mentioned in the assignment.
        Returns:
        the value of jumptime | result == getJumpTime()

      • jumpStep

        public double[] jumpStep(double time)
        Parameters:
        time - the timestamp for which the coordinates of the worm is wanted
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the worm at the requested time | result = {(getPosX() + (time * getJumpSpeedX())), | (getPosY() + (time * (getJumpSpeedY() - time * 9.80665)/2))}
